text: Dwayne John Bravo (born 7 October 1983) is a Trinidadian cricketer. He was the former captain of the West Indies national cricket team in all types of cricket matches. He is an all-rounder. He is a right handed batsman. He bowls right arm medium fast pace. He is particularly known for his aggressive (extra-ordinary in hitting boundaries like six and four) batting in the middle order. He is also known for his bowling in death overs. He plays for Chennai Super Kings in the Indian Premier League. In the Pakistani Super League he plays for Lahore Qalanders. He also had played for the Melbourne Renegades in the Big Bash League, the Chittagong Kings in the Bangladesh Premier League, and Kent and Essex in English county cricket.On 31 January 2015, Bravo announced his retirement from Test cricket. He continues to play ODIs and T20Is. ==References== Category:Trinidad and Tobago cricketers Category:1983 births Category:Living people
title: Dwayne Bravo
